italic.text: To reduce or negate the effects of existing or reinforcing obstacles. The objectives are to maintain freedom of movement for maneuver units, weapons systems and critical supplies.

line.text: In Sword, to bypass a set of sword objects. Bypassing an obstacle means to make it trafficable. Agents of the simulation becomes able to move through a bypassed obstacle with a limited speed of movement.

The commander agent issues the "Bypass obstacles" mission to the engineer platoons, with a set of obstacles as parameter. Obstacles are fairly shared between engineer platoons.
Other units are ordered to reach the meeting position (if the number of engineer platoons is greater than the number of obstacles, non used platoons are ordered to reach the meeting position).
When all obstacles have been bypassed, the engineer units move to the meeting position and the mission terminates.
The mission ends when all the subordinate agents have finished their mission.
